title: type parameter `OpaqueType/#0` (OpaqueType/0) out of range when substituting, substs=[]

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use std::mem; struct OpaqueTag{ offset: usize, len: usize, start_date: i128, } struct TagBlock { valid: u16, tags: [OpaqueType; Self::FIELD_LEN], } impl TagBlock { const FIELD_LEN: usize = 16; const TAG_SIZE: usize = mem::size_of::(); const TYPE_SIZE: usize = mem::size_of::(); pub fn change<'lf>(&'lf mut self, i: usize, valid: bool) -> Option<&'lf mut OpaqueType>{ None } pub fn tag<'lf>(&'lf self, i: usize) -> Option<&'lf OpaqueType> { None } } fn main(){} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` - 1.46.0 - beta 1.47 - nightly ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_middle/ty/subst.rs:529:17: type parameter `OpaqueType/#0` (OpaqueType/0) out of range when substituting, substs=[] ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/aa30bf3442be752e9f8dc9ff7fe70c258d41ac6b/src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:873:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::span_bug 2: rustc_errors::Handler::span_bug 3: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}} 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}} 5: 32: rustc_middle::ty::structural_impls::::super_fold_with 33: ::fold_ty 34: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 35: rustc_trait_selection::traits::project::normalize 36: ::partially_normalize_associated_types_in 37: as core::iter::traits::iterator::Iterator>::fold 38: rustc_infer::infer::InferCtxtBuilder::enter 39: rustc_typeck::check::wfcheck::check_item_well_formed unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.47.0-beta.3 (aa30bf344 2020-09-10) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [const_eval_raw] const-evaluating `TagBlock::tags::{{constant}}#0` #1 [const_eval_validated] const-evaluating + checking `TagBlock::tags::{{constant}}#0` #2 [const_eval_validated] const-evaluating + checking `TagBlock::tags::{{constant}}#0` #3 [check_item_well_formed] checking that `TagBlock` is well-formed #4 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error ```
